title: Broadway, East Side. Bowling Green to Hudson Bldg.

text:
A general view of lower Manhattan as photographed northward from over the Upper Bay. In the foreground is Battery Park, the Aquarium, South Ferry and its "El's", etc. Broadway, beginning at Bowling Green, divides the center. At the left is the marginal West Street, paralleling the shore of the North (Hudson) River. The three outstanding buildings at this date are the Singer, Woolworth and Municipal Bldgs.

About 1925

Ewing Galloway
title: General view - Lower Manhattan -[Upper New York Bay.]

text:
Battery Park: The Bowling Green-Broadway area as viewed from the rear of the Aquarium.  Outstanding there is the distinctive Standard Oil Company Building.  The inspiring Bank Of Manhattan Tower is just beyond.
1938-9
Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N.Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Manhattan: Battery Park.
